results.title: Conservation management of the new Mallee parks
results.creator_credit: Dept of Agriculture, Sunraysia, Horticultural Unit

video_links.name: Conservation management of the new Mallee parks

results.brief_description: The establishment of large National Parks in the Mallee have as their objective, the conservation of natural resources. As part of a conservation program, projects include revegetation to support wildlife and conserve the soil and pest control of noxious species such as rabbits. With its largely semi-arid climate, the Mallee, despite suffering from land degradation due to farming and livestock practices, is another of our natural treasures.

results.title: Curriculum by Technology
results.creator_credit: Brendan Kenworthy, Bendigo Education Resource Centre, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Shows how Bendigo Education Resource Centre is introducing new technology into distance education to increase the range of curriculum subjects offered for Year 11 and 12 students in isolated schoolos in the Mallee area: Telepaks, telephone links, fax machines, Macintosh computers, lessons on VHS tapes. Introduction by Justin Shortal.

results.title: Landholder Group Participation: a Model for Action
results.creator_credit: Peter Mountjoy and Warrenbayne Boho Land Protection Group
results.brief_description: Shows the process of landholders realising that the problems of salinity and erosion need to be tackled in groups rather than as individuals. Illustrates the establishment of the Warrenbayne Boho Land Protection Group. Shows the group working with Agriculture Extension Officers and Soil Conservation personnel, owning their involvement and taking responsibility for their actions. Useful as a model for people planning to establish community action groups.

results.title: 'Riff Raff the re-mix'
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Kids for kids”.
Riff-Raff, an Australian rock musical that launched the well known band “Men at Work” was re-staged at the Union Theatre, University of Melbourne. The musical touches upon the problems, frustrations and hopes of four teenagers living in the ‘80’s. It featured two Year 12 students who were involved in a professional performance for the first time and they discuss how they benefited from the experience. Contains interviews with the writer/director of the musical, Jan McDonald and writer/actor, Phil Sumner.

results.title: Using a computer catalogue
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Jenny Craig, Keith Rees, Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Because of changing library information systems, computerised catalogues are increasingly being used to record, store and retrieve holdings in libraries. Ann Hannan demostrates how to use the OPAC (On Line Public Access Catalogue) System, which is a touch system used in public libraries.

results.title: Changing Times - Changing Schools: Establishing Victorian Secondary Colleges
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Warren Thomas and Victoria. Ministry of Education

video_links.name: Changing Times - Changing Schools: Establishing Victorian Secondary Colleges

results.brief_description: Educational administrators, teachers, parents and students comment on a range of re-organisation arrangements developed to enable Victorian secondary schools to better respond to todays workforce requirements and the needs of young adults in schooling.

results.title: Communication without speech
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Recent advances in technology have enabled the development of a range of sophisticated communication devices which, with the assistance of microprocessors, enables students with severe communication impairment to communicate, using voice and print.
